sentences.english: For the study, published in the September issue of Pediatrics, researchers identified 28 babies who spent time in the NICU and were later diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发表在九月份的《儿科》杂志上面。

sentences.english: Too many magazines like to feature sleek models on the cover.
sentences.chinese: 太多的杂志喜欢用时尚模特儿作封面。

sentences.english: Some experts consider that E -magazine and paper magazine will supplement each other.
sentences.chinese: 业内专家认为，网络杂志和纸介杂志将相辅相承。

sentences.english: Some experts consider that E -magazine and paper magazine will supplement each other.
sentences.chinese: 业内专家认为，网络杂志和纸介杂志将相辅相承。

sentences.english: There'sno need for that kind of language in this magazine .
sentences.chinese: 这份杂志没必要出现那种语言。

sentences.english: He faned his face with a magzine.
The work is published in the European Journal of Operational Research.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究调查刊登在欧洲运筹学杂志上。

sentences.english: When I take a shower, he grabs a magazine and sits on the toilet, reading.
sentences.chinese: 我洗澡时他拿了本杂志进来坐在马桶上念。

sentences.english: The New York magazine is no stranger to controversial covers.
sentences.chinese: 纽约杂志对争议性封面司空见惯。

sentences.english: This is the webpage of Journal of Cutaneous Medicine and Surgery.
sentences.chinese: 这是《皮肤医学和外科学杂志》的网页。

sentences.english: Norwegian Journal of Entomology, with Insekt-Nytt.
sentences.chinese: 挪威昆虫学杂志》附《昆虫新闻》。

sentences.english: She leafed through some old magazines while waiting for her husband.
sentences.chinese: 在等她的丈夫时，她翻阅了一些旧杂志。

sentences.english: Kummerfeld is currently a member of the Management Board of FIPP, the International Magazine Association.
sentences.chinese: 目前是国际杂志协会管理委员会委员之一。

sentences.english: At the Vanity Fair party, they were let in the back door.
sentences.chinese: 在《名利场》杂志的聚会上，他们从后门进来。

sentences.english: Include the latest edition of the local paper, magazines that might be of interest or your local “What’s Up?
sentences.chinese: 包括最新版的当地报纸，杂志。

definition: to carry a story/to publish (in a newspaper or magazine)
to start publishing/to found a journal
to print/to publish/publication/periodical/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
old variant of 刊[kan1]/to peel with a knife/to carve/to amend
